summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Airline Reporting Corporation, demanding travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell for two time periods (1994-1998 and 2019 onward). The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena requests all travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell from the Airline Reporting Corporation for specified time periods as part of a federal criminal investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands the Airline Reporting Corporation to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to the Airline Reporting Corporation for travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Airline Reporting Corporation, 3000 Wilson Blvd., Suite 300, Arlington, VA 22201
Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks all travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell from January 1, 1994 through December 31, 1998 and from July 1, 2019 through the date of service.

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requests that the Airline Reporting Corporation not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document indicates an active federal grand jury investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell was ongoing as of January 2020.
The subpoena specifically targets the Airline Reporting Corporation, which processes airline ticket transactions, suggesting investigators were seeking to trace Maxwell's travel patterns.
